member.name: T:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics
member.summary: Specifies the values for the property of the COFF header of a PE image file.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.RelocationStripped
member.summary: Specifies that the file does not contain base relocations and must therefore be loaded at its preferred base address. If the base address is not available, the loader reports an error. The default behavior of the linker is to strip base relocations from executable (EXE) files.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.Executable
member.summary: Specifies that the image file is valid and can be run. If this flag is not set, it indicates a linker error.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.LineNumbersStripped
member.summary: Specifies that COFF line numbers have been removed. This flag is deprecated and should be zero.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.SymbolsStripped
member.summary: Specifies that COFF symbol table entries for local symbols have been removed. This flag is deprecated and should be zero.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.AggressivelyTrimWorkingSet
member.summary: Specifies to aggressively trim working set. This flag is deprecated for Windows 2000 and later and must be zero.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.LargeAddressAware
member.summary: Specifies that the application can handle > 2 GB addresses.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.BytesReversedLo
member.summary: Specifies little endian: The least significant bit (LSB) precedes the most significant bit (MSB) in memory. This flag is deprecated and should be zero.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.Machine32
member.summary: Specifies that the machine is based on a 32-bit-word architecture.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.DebugStripped
member.summary: Specifies that debugging information is removed from the image file.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.RemovableRunFromSwap
member.summary: Specifies that if the image is on removable media, to fully load it and copy it to the swap file.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.NetRunFromSwap
member.summary: Specifies that if the image is on network media, to fully load it and copy it to the swap file.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.System
member.summary: Specifies that the image file is a system file, not a user program.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.Dll
member.summary: Specifies that the image file is a dynamic-link library (DLL). Such files are considered executable files for almost all purposes, although they cannot be directly run.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.UpSystem
member.summary: Specifies that the file should be run only on a uniprocessor machine.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCharacteristics.BytesReversedHi
member.summary: Specifies big endian: the MSB precedes the LSB in memory. This flag is deprecated and should be zero.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader
member.summary: Represents the COFF header of a PE image file.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.Machine
member.summary: Gets the number that identifies the type of target machine.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.NumberOfSections
member.summary: Gets the number of sections. This indicates the size of the section table, which immediately follows the headers.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.TimeDateStamp
member.summary: Gets the low 32 bits of the number of seconds since 01.01.1970 00:00:00, that indicates when the file was created.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.TimeDateStampValue
member.summary: Gets the representation of the property.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.PointerToSymbolTable
member.summary: Gets the file offset of the COFF symbol table, or zero if no COFF symbol table is present. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.NumberOfSymbols
member.summary: Gets the number of entries in the symbol table. This data can be used to locate the string table, which immediately follows the symbol table. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.SizeOfOptionalHeader
member.summary: Gets the size of the optional header, which is required for executable files but not for object files. This value should be zero for an object file.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageCoffHeader.Characteristics
member.summary: Gets the flags that indicate the attributes of the file.

member.summary: Gets the size of the uninitialized data section (BSS), or the sum of all such sections if there are multiple BSS sections.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.AddressOfEntryPoint
member.summary: Gets the address of the entry point relative to the image base when the executable file is loaded into memory. For program images, this is the starting address. For device drivers, this is the address of the initialization function. An entry point is optional for DLLs. When no entry point is present, this property must be zero.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.BaseOfCode
member.summary: Gets the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-code section when it is loaded into memory.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.SectionAlignment
member.summary: Gets the alignment (in bytes) of sections when they are loaded into memory. It must be greater than or equal to . The default is the page size for the architecture.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.FileAlignment
member.summary: Gets the alignment factor (in bytes) that is used to align the raw data of sections in the image file. The value should be a power of 2 between 512 and 64 K, inclusive. The default is 512. If the is less than the architecture's page size, then must match .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.SizeOfImage
member.summary: Gets the size (in bytes) of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory. It must be a multiple of .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.SizeOfHeaders
member.summary: Gets the combined size of an MS-DOS stub, PE header, and section headers rounded up to a multiple of .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageOptionalHeader.Checksum
member.summary: Gets the image file checksum. The algorithm for computing the checksum is incorporated into IMAGHELP.DLL. The following are checked for validation at load time: all drivers, any DLL loaded at boot time, and any DLL that is loaded into a critical Windows process.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader
member.summary: Represents a section header of a PE image file.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.Name
member.summary: Gets an 8-byte, null-padded UTF-8 encoded string. If the string is exactly 8 characters long, there is no terminating null. For longer names, this property contains a slash (/) that is followed by an ASCII representation of a decimal number that is an offset into the string table. Executable images do not use a string table and do not support section names longer than 8 characters. Long names in object files are truncated if they are emitted to an executable file.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.VirtualSize
member.summary: Gets the total size of the section when loaded into memory. If this value is greater than , the section is zero-padded. This property is valid only for executable images and should be set to zero for object files.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.VirtualAddress
member.summary: For executable images, Gets the address of the first byte of the section relative to the image base when the section is loaded into memory. For object files, this property is the address of the first byte before relocation is applied; for simplicity, compilers should set this to zero. Otherwise, it is an arbitrary value that is subtracted from offsets during relocation.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.SizeOfRawData
member.summary: Gets the size of the section (for object files) or the size of the initialized data on disk (for image files). For executable images, this must be a multiple of from the optional header. If this is less than , the remainder of the section is zero-filled. Because the property is rounded but the property is not, it is possible for to be greater than as well. When a section contains only uninitialized data, this property should be zero.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.PointerToRawData
member.summary: Gets the file pointer to the first page of the section within the COFF file. For executable images, this must be a multiple of from the optional header. For object files, the value should be aligned on a 4-byte boundary for best performance. When a section contains only uninitialized data, this property should be zero.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.PointerToRelocations
member.summary: Gets the file pointer to the beginning of relocation entries for the section. This is set to zero for executable images or if there are no relocations.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.PointerToLineNumbers
member.summary: Gets the file pointer to the beginning of line-number entries for the section. This is set to zero if there are no COFF line numbers. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.NumberOfRelocations
member.summary: Gets the number of relocation entries for the section. This is set to zero for executable images.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.NumberOfLineNumbers
member.summary: Gets the number of line-number entries for the section. This value should be zero for an image because COFF debugging information is deprecated.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.Characteristics
member.summary: Gets the flags that describe the characteristics of the section.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.FileFormats.PE.ImageSectionHeader.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of this .
member.returns: The name of this .
